title: Social Constructivist-Based Digital Literacy Game Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Smartphone Usage Skills and Adaptation to Digital Environments
context.additional_context: Participants (social sector practitioners) engage to strengthen digital tool competencies. Focuses on practical task performance mediated by game design in constrained technological environments (smartphone-centric)

learning_goals: Learners can apply the six digital literacy practice domains (Create, Manage, Publish, Socialize, Research, Surf) to game design projects.
Through collaboration with peers, learners can create and share digital content while systematically managing feedback processes.
By critically analyzing information gathered during game development, learners enhance their ability to utilize digital resources within social contexts.

resources: Collaboration tools (mobile versions of Padlet, Google Docs, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
